findings.title: Transaction-Ordering Dependence (TOD) in approve method
findings.description: Changing an allowance with `approve` and `approveAndCall` brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering.

findings.title: Chance of balance getting overwritten during the contract deployment
findings.description: If the same address is used in the constructor for different years, then the balance for that particular address will be overwritten during each assignment.

findings.title: Consider using the 'years' alias
findings.description: Solidity provides a global variable that accounts for years in unix time. Using this would make the time variables easier to read and much less error prone.
